comments.commentBody: Whenever you hear some government employee say a business broke the law, you should know they mean to extract money from the company. If government was really concerned about the law being broken, they would arrest these people. Do any of you think that will happen? Call me incredulous but they just want money.

"individual employees remain unpunished."

Except that the individual, un-uionized employees "just following orders" _never_ "remain unpunished." It's the executives who "remain unpunished."

"insurance that covers drivers and passengers"

To what extent? The legal minimum that barely covers a dented fender, let alone catastrophic injury and subsequent hospitalization?

this is genuinely surprising and it sure explains a lot about my situation. it also speaks so clearly to the utter lack of concern for customer and driver safety by uber. among my friends, ranging from age 30-45, we have all deleted the uber app recently based on bad experiences, ranging from lost drivers to surge pricing, the near constant stream of negative press, and especially for their treatment of women.  the CEO"s continued questionable conduct underscores the lack of real leadership needed to guide a maturing company out of their frat house haze and into a more evolved organization. it's pretty clear that it's time for Kalanick to move along.

"uber is one of the good guys"

What "good" are the "good guys" doing?

Am also blind and use a guide dog to get around.  I Have been denied service on both Uuber and Lyft.  This is after a class action suit was settled against UBER  for denying service to the blind whom use guide dogs.   It appears I will be tied up suing the ride share services until driverless cars become a reality.

"Don't Americans drive cabs anymore?"

A better question is, "Don't Americans like M.Lou Simpson prefer to drive cabs, when they can get better jobs, instead?"

Quite a claim that government provides no real oversight or protection:  Before  I drove a taxi (during college) I had to file with the police and be fingerprinted for a criminal background check.  I do not know how thorough that check was, but as I drove women around at night I assumed it probably kept some troublesome men from that job. I also know the taxi company owner did not seem himself in collusion with anyone, let alone the police.

"Uber has a $1 million liability policy over all drivers."

Unless Uber has a million-dollar liability policy cover _each_ driver _and_ his passenger for _any_ kind of accident that might reasonably happen, such as I have on my personal car, then what Uber is doing doesn't even rise to the level of bad propaganda.
Sounds like the problem is authorities wanting to control everything.

I have served as a CASA volunteer for nearly 9 years attempting to see that abused and neglected children find safe permanent homes. Again and again, I see 19/20 year old girls with 4 to 5 kids by 4 or 5 different men none of whom are around to help or pay support. The girl got pregnant at 14 or 15 and dropped out of school. Now she has no education, no skills and no hope. Poverty is her only future and it is nearly impossible that the kids are not neglected or abused by the next ole boy who comes around for as several have told me, the only thing she has to offer, what she has between her legs.  Sex education and birth control are cuss words to the neandertals who inhabit the Texas legilature and yet they howl at the expense of funding Child Protective Services.  They are all about protecting the socalled 'unborn' but when children hit the ground in Texas, they are on their own! Preventing pregnancy is just unGodly.

The 7 almonds thing was debunked long ago. And Obama wasn't all that buttoned up. He was a doting, enchanted dad and husband, he could cut a rug (and sing!), he had real friendships, he had a lively and artsy social life, and he had a great sense of humor.

Our current president is rich but a Neanderthal, lacking every social grace, He lacks the moral compass, judgment, care, honesty, work ethic, intelligence, education, and compassion of Obama. He lacks (even) the tastebuds. The tastebuds are just a rounding error, in the scheme of things.
....and read books, which this pres clearly does not

Hey. I'm offended. I feel the need to speak up in defense of all of us Neanderthals out here. We tend to like our steaks pretty bloody, with a side of marrow and maybe a few nuts and berries.
Never heard of ketchup. What's that?

@Melissa: what you don't say is that not only was it debunked...but the reason it is repeated ad nauseum is that the NYTIMES! reported this as fact, when it was actually a JOKE.

Later Obama admitted it was a joke, and didn't know how it got repeated as if it were factually true. In fact, he supposedly has as much a junk food habit as anyone. Oh...and those almonds? he eats lost more than 7, and they are CHOCOLATE COATED.

Now, I don't care because that made Obama human. Only a Spock-like machine could count out 7 almonds each night and nothing else.

And as for your comments: Trump is a good father, beloved by his kids. You have no right to claim otherwise. You may hate him, but you don't have the right to claim he is a bad father.

A person's tastebuds are private and personal. It is bizarre to judge people by what foods they like or dislike.

Exactly! Disband the Departments of Defense, the Army, the Air Force, the Marine Corps, and the Coast Guard, saving _trillions_ in taxes. The money can be used by the people to buy assault rifles or whatever else they decide to use for themselves.

You cant afford Uber if you work at McDonalds.  Look up wages, look up the cost of housing and the cost of basic food and then figure a budget.  You're either going to take public transportation (if you can afford it) or walk.
After all, businesses are people, too. Right, Spade?

The interesting news isn't what Uber did, but what municipalities around the country did to prevent Uber from working without passing any new laws, so as to keep the lucrative taxicab license marketplace alive by harming Uber, which was doing nothing illegal. Ticket drivers who aren't doing anything wrong. Find reasons to impound their vehicles. Act like the Gestapo.

So, my take away is this: We have Uber doing something which isn't illegal, but which adversaries want to make illegal. Uber counters with technical means which prevent the adversaries from realizing their desires and which provide Uber intelligence about tactics their adversaries are using.

I love Uber!

How about reading some history books and find out what Malcolm X and Martin Luther King stood for?

Can you imagine that that sleazy UBER CEO would put his life on the line to overcome Jim Crow's laws that made it impossible for black folks to register to vote?

Your comparison sickens me.

You're to one standing against progress in the form of living wages and security. Actually you're pretty shortsighted. People who don't have a living wage, do not patronize stores, and so many doesn't circulate. A recipe for not just another Great Recession but another Great Depression.

Do now use altruistic heroes to justify the reign of selfishness and shortsightedness that you're confusing with technological progress.
himmm, to me, what uber did seems equable to what the ICE agents recently did in LA .... wearing jackets printed with " Police " during a detainment.....
Oh yes, and that goes for every criminal, right?  If your mugger is smart enough to avoid being caught, good for him -- is this what you're advocating?

Not "willing" but forced by circumstances to work for not a living wage.  Easily remedied by raising the minimum wage and not letting the fiction of "independent contractor" override every decent benefit we worked so long to acquire.  I guess you want us to go back to the era of robber barons and child labor etc?

Well, for one thing, anything that happens to you is a problem for you and, no doubt, the driver. Uber is not legally responsible for the actions of the driver, is not obligated to provide any equipment or to maintain it, or to provide any passenger or any driver with insurance.

You're no better off than thumbing a ride.
Authorities do that for example to capture the person who mugged  you.  Do you object to that too?

So, if Mike Isaac has his life investigated by people hired by people hired by Uber, what might the investigators find that is incriminating? Probably the most incriminating thing will be that Farhad Manjoo actually writes all of Mike's articles because he feels sorry for Mike. (no, I just made that up)

"Perhaps it is the drivers - if they are not too desperate and beholden - who have to be the first to come together to increase their power vis a vis their de facto employer."

By doing what? Come together to increase their power vis a vis their de facto employer by organizing a union? Capitalism is anti-union.

"Meet the New Boss...Same as the Old Boss..."
The New Tech Economy is just as dirty as the old one. At a $70 billion valuation you'd think they'd pay the fines. Oh wait I guess corporate greed never goes out of style.
